alert.note: Alert for Coeur d'Alene Area; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued December 16 at 12:46PM MST until December 16 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility 3 to 4 miles in dense fog. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, stagnant conditions will have potential to trap pollutants near the ground with deteriorated air quality. * WHERE...Coeur d`Alene, Hayden, Post Falls, Worley, Athol, Eastport, Bonners Ferry, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Priest River, Clark Fork, and Sandpoint. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 2 PM PST this afternoon. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous. Periods of air stagnation can lead to the buildup of pollutants near the surface.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Buildup of fine pollution particles can be harmful to those sensitive to air pollution including people with lung and heart problems, people with diabetes, children and the elderly.
